description: McChili is a chelated zinc fertilizer containing 10% zinc. Chelated zinc provides better plant uptake and prevents zinc deficiency symptoms in crops.
application_rates: 17 gm / Bigha (33 decimal); First of all take 100 ml of water in a pot, then add 17 gm McChili in the water and mix it well.; Then take 20ml of this mixture in 10 Lit of water and mix it well and spray.; We can use the first prepared 100 ml 5 times i.e. 5 X 10 Lit = 50 Lit of water i.e. 100 ml original preparation for 50 Lit of water for 1 bigha.; In case of rice, 1stspray should be done 3 weeks after transplanting and 2ndspray 6 weeks after transplanting.
frequency_of_use: Apply 2 times during growing season - 3 weeks and 6 weeks after transplanting for rice
side_effect: Generally safe for plants and environment. Use protective equipment during application. Store away from children and animals.
symptoms: Yellowing of leaves, stunted growth, reduced leaf size, poor fruit development
causes: Zinc deficiency in soil affecting plant growth and development
